history.content: Yo are you me? I'm in the same exact boat rn. I personally applied to the econ major first normally (it's basically a Google form) and then the CS major. I talked to a cs major advisor and they told me to apply to the CS major without checking the double major option since CS declaration is pretty quick as soon as grades come out. I'll be applying for the DS major in about a week or so since we can only apply to it in the last three weeks of the semester. Feel free to message me so we can figure this process out!

I talked to a cs major advisor and they told me to apply to the CS major without checking the double major option since CS declaration is pretty quick as soon as grades come out. I'll be applying for the DS major in about a week or so since we can only apply to it in the last three weeks of the semester.

Yo are you me? I'm in the same exact boat rn. I personally applied to the econ major first (it's basically a Google form) and then the CS major. I talked to a cs major advisor and they told me to apply to the CS major without checking the double major option since CS declaration is pretty quick as soon as grades come out. I'll be applying for the DS major in about a week or so since we can only apply to it in the last three weeks of the semester.

I'm an intended triple major (CS, DS, Econ), and am currently enrolled in the last prerequisites for application to all three of those majors.

I'm currently undeclared. How should I go about applying to the CS major? Should I apply as a multiple major or as one major if I'm also applying to the rest of the majors simultaneously?
history.subject: Applying to Multiple Majors in Same Semester
